Authors: Jiang Xu, Tai Hu Li, Alfredo Justo, Zai-Wei Ge
Title:
Two new species of Pluteus (Agaricales: Pluteaceae) from
China
Abstract:
Two new species of Pluteus section Pluteus, P.
purpureofuscus and P. griseodiscus, are described as new, based on
collections from China. P. purpureofuscus is characterized by the
purple-brown colors of pileus, presence of clamp-connections, and
habitat on coniferous wood. P. griseodiscus is characterized by the pale
colors of the basidiocarps, non-pigmented lamellar edges, thick-walled
cheilocystidia and the presence of caulocystidia. The phylogenetic
position of both species, based on nrITS data is also discussed.
